name: Orion
when_to_use: Use when you need comprehensive expertise across all domains, framework component creation/modification, workflow orchestration, or running tasks that don't require a specialized persona.

name: Atlas
when_to_use:
Use for market research, competitive analysis, user research, brainstorming session facilitation, structured ideation workshops, feasibility studies, industry trends analysis, project discovery (brownfield documentation), and research report creation.

NOT for: PRD creation or product strategy â†’ Use @pm. Technical architecture decisions or technology selection â†’ Use @architect. Story creation or sprint planning â†’ Use @sm.

name: Aria
when_to_use:
Use for system architecture (fullstack, backend, frontend, infrastructure), technology stack selection (technical evaluation), API design (REST/GraphQL/tRPC/WebSocket), security architecture, performance optimization, deployment strategy, and cross-cutting concerns (logging, monitoring, error handling).

NOT for: Market research or competitive analysis â†’ Use @analyst. PRD creation or product strategy â†’ Use @pm. Database schema design or query optimization â†’ Use @data-engineer.

name: Dara
when_to_use: Use for database design, schema architecture, Supabase configuration, RLS policies, migrations, query optimization, data modeling, operations, and monitoring

name: Dex
when_to_use: Use for code implementation, debugging, refactoring, and development best practices

name: Gage
when_to_use: Use for repository operations, version management, CI/CD, quality gates, and GitHub push operations. ONLY agent authorized to push to remote repository.

name: Morgan
when_to_use:
Use for PRD creation (greenfield and brownfield), epic creation and management, product strategy and vision, feature prioritization (MoSCoW, RICE), roadmap planning, business case development, go/no-go decisions, scope definition, success metrics, and stakeholder communication.

Epic/Story Delegation (Gate 1 Decision): PM creates epic structure, then delegates story creation to @sm.

NOT for: Market research or competitive analysis â†’ Use @analyst. Technical architecture design or technology selection â†’ Use @architect. Detailed user story creation â†’ Use @sm (PM creates epics, SM creates stories). Implementation work â†’ Use @dev.

name: Pax
when_to_use: Use for backlog management, story refinement, acceptance criteria, sprint planning, and prioritization decisions

name: Quinn
when_to_use: Use for comprehensive test architecture review, quality gate decisions, and code improvement. Provides thorough analysis including requirements traceability, risk assessment, and test strategy. Advisory only - teams choose their quality bar.

name: River
when_to_use:
Use for user story creation from PRD, story validation and completeness checking, acceptance criteria definition, story refinement, sprint planning, backlog grooming, retrospectives, daily standup facilitation, and local branch management (create/switch/list/delete local branches, local merges).

Epic/Story Delegation (Gate 1 Decision): PM creates epic structure, SM creates detailed user stories from that epic.

NOT for: PRD creation or epic structure â†’ Use @pm. Market research or competitive analysis â†’ Use @analyst. Technical architecture design â†’ Use @architect. Implementation work â†’ Use @dev. Remote Git operations (push, create PR, merge PR, delete remote branches) â†’ Use @github-devops.

name: Craft
when_to_use: Use to create, validate, publish and manage squads

name: Uma
when_to_use: Complete design workflow - user research, wireframes, design systems, token extraction, component building, and quality assurance
